thread.title: 7 Georgia players Alabama fans should be familiar with besides Nick Chubb, Greyson Lambert
thread.title_full: 7 Georgia players Alabama fans should be familiar with besides Nick Chubb, Greyson Lambert

author: Matt Zenitz | mzenitz@al.com
title: 7 Georgia players Alabama fans should be familiar with besides Nick Chubb, Greyson Lambert
text:
7 Georgia players Alabama fans should be familiar with besides Nick Chubb, Greyson Lambert Isaiah McKenzie Georgia’s Isaiah McKenzie (16) returns a punt 77 yards for a touchdown against Vanderbilt during the first half Saturday in Nashville, Tennessee. Mark Humphrey AP (Associated Press) Comments 
Nick Chubb is Georgia's biggest star, a standout sophomore running back and the clear centerpiece of the Bulldogs' offense. 
Greyson Lambert is Georgia's new quarterback, a Virginia transfer who has completed 33 of 35 passes with five touchdowns and no interceptions during the Bulldogs' last two games. 
Here are seven other Georgia players Alabama fans should be familiar with heading into the No. 13 Tide's matchup with the No. 8 Bulldogs Saturday in Athens (listed alphabetically): 
Junior outside linebacker Leonard Floyd 
CBS Sports ranks the 6-foot-3, 230-pound Floyd as the second-best outside linebacker prospect and 10 th -best overall prospect among players eligible for the 2016 NFL draft. 
Floyd's 23 tackles are tied for a team-high. He has 3.5 stops for a loss, two sacks, four quarterback hurries and two pass breakups. 
He was named Georgia's team MVP last season after posting 55 tackles, 8.5 stops for a loss and six sacks. 
Senior inside linebacker Jake Ganus 
The UAB transfer from Chelsea is sixth on the Bulldogs with 19 tackles and has an interception. 
Ganus was a three-year starter at UAB. 
He transferred to Georgia in December following the elimination of the Blazers' football program. 
Senior outside linebacker Jordan Jenkins 
CBS Sports projects Jenkins will be selected in the second round of next year's NFL draft. 
A four-year starter, the 6-foot-3, 255-pound Jenkins is tied for the team-lead with 23 tackles. 
He has 6.5 tackles for a loss, three sacks and nine quarterback hurries. 
The Georgia native recorded 11 tackles, 5.5 stops for a loss and two sacks during the Bulldogs' 31-14 win over Vanderbilt Sept. 12. 
Sophomore wide receiver/returner Isaiah McKenzie 
The 5-foot-8, 170-pound sophomore is likely one of the most dangerous returners in the country. 
He had three returns for touchdowns as a freshman last season — two on punts and one kickoff. 
He had a 77-yard punt return for a touchdown against Vanderbilt Sept. 12. 
McKenzie has five catches for 89 yards as well as two carries for 32 yards. 
Sophomore running back Sony Michel 
Chubb and Michel form arguably the top running back tandem in the country. 
While Chubb has twice as many carries, the 5-foot-11, 210-pound Michel has rushed for 223 yards and four touchdowns on 32 attempts. 
He is averaging 7.0 yards per carry. 
Georgia also splits Michel out as a wide receiver. He has eight catches for 148 yards and three scores. 
Michel has at least one run or catch of 20 yards or longer in each of the Bulldogs' first four games. 
He is posting an average of 92.75 total yards per game — combining rushing and receiving yards. 
Senior wide receiver Malcolm Mitchell 
After playing in just nine games in 2013 and 2014 due to injury, Mitchell has emerged as the clear top option in Georgia's passing game. 
The 6-foot-1, 195-pound Mitchell has 20 catches for 306 yards and three touchdowns after catching 31 passes for just 248 yards and three scores in eight games last year. 
Mitchell caught eight passes for 122 yards and a touchdown during the Bulldogs' 52-20 win over South Carolina Sept. 19. 
Mitchell has nearly three times as many catches as any other Georgia wide receiver. 
Freshman Terry Godwin is second on the team among wide receivers with seven catches. 
Junior right guard Greg Pyke 
CBS Sports ranks the 6-foot-6, 315-pound Pyke as the second-best NFL prospect among junior offensive guards. 
Pyke was a second-team All-SEC selection as a sophomore last season. 
The Maryland native will be matched against an Alabama defensive line with two interior defensive linemen — A'Shawn Robinson and Jarran Reed — who are widely projected to be selected during the first two rounds of next year's NFL draft.
